title: Prince Harry testifies that he was kept in the dark about phone-tapping allegations
description: Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex, testified in British court that years of not knowing about alleged breaches in privacy committed by Associated Papers created a sense of paranoia and strained personal relationships.

title: Biden and McCarthy barely speak, dimming prospects for a debt ceiling deal
description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy and President Joe Biden rarely speak and have only met once as they face a June deadline to raise the debt ceiling.

title: YouTube says graphic Nashville body camera video can stay online despite rules against violent content
description: YouTube said Tuesday that the police body camera video from the school shooting Monday in Nashville, Tennessee, would normally violate its policies.

title: Fox tries to stop Rupert Murdoch from testifying in person at the Dominion trial
description: Lawyers for Fox News were met with skepticism when they argued that Rupert Murdoch should be excused from testifying in court as part of the Dominion lawsuit.

title: How is bitcoin still trading (for now) at $27,000?
description: Why is one bitcoin, after all the disasters in the crypto industry, trading at about $27,000?

title: N.Y. grand jury not expected to vote on possible Trump indictment this week
description: The New York grand jury considering possible criminal charges against former President Donald Trump is not expected to vote this week on a possible indictment.

title: Adnan Syed's murder conviction reinstated months after he was freed
description: Maryland's appeal court reinstated the murder conviction against Adnan Syed known from the podcast 'Serial,' months after prosecutors provided new evidence in the 1999 murder of Hae Min Lee.

title: Some on the right blame gender identity and not guns for Nashville shooting
description: Some conservatives rushed to blame the Nashville shootings on the suspect’s gender identity, connecting the tragedy to their national crusade against transgender rights.

title: Federal judge orders Pence to testify in special counsel probe investigating Trump
description: A federal judge has ordered former Vice President Mike Pence to comply with a grand jury subpoena from the special counsel about former President Donald Trump.

title: The fight for Israel's political life is on pause but far from over. Here's what to know.
description: Israel’s political crisis is far from over.

title: Apple launches its Pay Later service
description: Apple on Tuesday introduced Apple Pay Later, which will allow users to split purchases into four payments spread over the course of six weeks.

title: Sen. Rand Paul says his aide was 'brutally attacked' in D.C.
description: Sen. Rand Paul confirmed a member of his congressional staff was "brutally attacked" over the weekend and a suspect was arrested in connection with the crime.

title: Body camera footage shows the moment police confront and fire at Nashville shooter
description: Body camera footage released Tuesday morning by the Metropolitan Nashville Police Department shows the moment police officers Rex Engelbert and Michael Collazo confronted and fired at the shooter at The Covenant School.

title: Senate holds its first hearing into SVB and Signature Bank failures
description: The Senate Banking Committee is slated to hold its first hearing Tuesday into the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank and resulting financial turbulence.

title: Sam Bankman-Fried allegedly bribed one Chinese official with $40 million
description: Former cryptocurrency mogul Sam Bankman-Fried has been hit with another federal charge: bribery.

title: Twitter celebs balk at paying Elon Musk for blue check mark
description: William Shatner, Monica Lewinsky and other prolific Twitter commentators could soon be losing the blue check marks that helped verify their identity on the social media platform.

title: How companies are surveilling WFH employees with 'tattleware'
description: With many employees still working from home, some companies are installing “tattleware” to monitor productivity, while some employees are finding ways to get around it with other software designed to keep the cursor moving. NBC’s Vicky Nguyen reports for TODAY.

title: At least 39 dead in fire at a migrant center in Mexico near the U.S. border
description: At least 39 people were killed after a fire broke out at a migration center in Ciudad Juarez along the U.S.-Mexico border, officials have said.

title: Nashville police investigate motive as families grieve
description: Police investigate motive as families grieve

title: Nashville police release security footage showing shooter entering school
description: Police in Nashville have released security video showing the shooter arriving on campus at a private Christian school before killing six people on Monday.

title: At least 39 dead in fire at a migrant center in Mexico near the U.S. border
description: At least 39 people were killed after a fire broke out at a migration center in Ciudad Juarez along the U.S.-Mexico border, officials have said.

title: Police chief tells NBC News a sense of ‘resentment’ may have fueled Nashville shooter’s attack at former school
description: Audrey Hale, the school shooter who killed six people in Nashville on Monday, appears to be a former student of the Christian campus, police said.

title: Losing weight is good for the heart, even if you regain some of it
description: Losing weight — even if some pounds are gained back ​​– may help your heart over the long term. Improvements in blood pressure and blood sugar can help delay heart disease or diabetes.

title: Alibaba founder Jack Ma resurfaces in China in sign tech crackdown may be easing
description: Alibaba founder Jack Ma has been spotted in China after spending months abroad in a potential sign that Beijing is warming to technology giants again.

title: In his return to Fox News, Trump labels the Manhattan DA's probe a 'new way of cheating in elections'
description: Former President Donald Trump returned to Fox News Monday night for an interview with host Sean Hannity.

title: Inside the Drone Racing League
description: The Drone Racing League, which is part competition, part technology, and part entertainment, is the latest innovation in the world of sports. NBC’s Gadi Schwartz speaks with the league’s president and top players to dive into the future of organization.
